summary.text_en: Pasteur proved diseases caused by microorganisms! He invented pasteurization, saving countless lives. He also developed rabies vaccine, pioneering immunology. His motto: 'Chance favors the prepared mind.'

story.text_en: In 1862, Pasteur used famous 'swan-neck flask experiment' proving life doesn't spontaneously generate, microorganisms come from airborne bacteria. On July 6, 1885, 9-year-old Joseph, bitten by rabid dog, was brought in. Pasteur took huge risk, injecting him with rabies vaccine. The boy survived! First time in human history successfully preventing deadly disease with vaccine.

fun_facts.text_en: Young Pasteur dreamed of being painter, his portrait paintings were excellent!
He studied why wine turns sour, discovered fermentation is microbial action, saving French wine industry.
He had stroke at 46 causing paralysis, but continued experimenting with one hand, completing greatest work.

experiment.description_en: Pasteur designed curved swan-neck flask with boiled broth inside. Air could enter but bacteria trapped in curve. Result: broth never spoiled! If neck broken, bacteria enter, broth immediately spoils. This simple experiment completely overturned 'spontaneous generation', proving microorganisms come from environment.
experiment.why_en: Microorganisms don't spontaneously generate, they come from environmental sources like air, water, contact.

simple_explanation.text_en: Imagine your body as castle, bacteria as attacking enemies. Pasteur discovered: disease isn't castle getting sick itself, but enemies (bacteria) invading! He invented three solutions: 1) Heat kills bacteria (pasteurization); 2) Train soldiers to recognize enemies (vaccines); 3) Keep castle clean (aseptic technique).

impact.text_en: Pasteur's germ theory revolutionized medicine! Before him, doctors operated without washing hands, maternal mortality 30%. His discovery made humans understand infectious disease nature, spawning modern medicine, public health, food safety fields. Hailed as 'Father of Microbiology', saved more lives than anyone in history.

influenced_by.contribution_en: Invented smallpox vaccine, inspired immunology thinking

influenced.contribution_en: Established Koch's postulates for bacterial causation

influence_chain.legacy_text_en: Pasteur stood on shoulders of Leeuwenhoek (first saw bacteria) and Jenner (smallpox vaccine), proving germ theory. Koch further refined this theory, Lister applied it to surgery. Fleming's antibiotic discovery and Salk's polio vaccine all developed on microbiology foundation Pasteur pioneered.

quiz.question_en: What did Pasteur's swan-neck flask experiment prove?
quiz.explanation_en: Swan-neck flask experiment proved microorganisms don't spontaneously generate but come from existing bacteria in environment. Curved neck blocked airborne bacteria, so broth didn't spoil. This overturned 2000-year-old 'spontaneous generation' theory.
